meanings.definition: Capable of being reversed or undone.
meanings.sent1: The jacket was reversible, so I could wear it inside out if I wanted.
meanings.sent2: The mistake I made was reversible, and I could easily fix it.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally put my shirt on backwards, but luckily it was reversible!
meanings.sent4: Her decision to quit her job was reversible, like a car backing up.
meanings.sent5: The magician performed a reversible trick, making the rabbit disappear and then reappear.

meanings.definition: Able to be turned inside out or upside down.
meanings.sent1: The umbrella was reversible, allowing me to use it even when it was windy.
meanings.sent2: The pillow had a reversible cover, so I could change its look easily.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally wore my reversible hat inside out, but it still looked cool!
meanings.sent4: His mood was like a reversible jacket, changing quickly from happy to sad.
meanings.sent5: The map was reversible, showing both the regular and mirrored views of the city.

meanings.definition: A garment or fabric that can be worn or used on either side.
meanings.sent1: She loved her reversible dress because she could switch up the style whenever she wanted.
meanings.sent2: The reversible blanket kept me warm on one side and cool on the other.
meanings.sent3: The reversible tablecloth was a hit at the party, with guests flipping it to match the theme.
meanings.sent4: The reversible curtains in the room made it easy to control the amount of light coming in.
meanings.sent5: The reversible bag was perfect for travel, offering two looks in one accessory.
